Name: Gerfried Stocker

Name: Sebastian Endler
Institution Description: CIS specialises in immersive media and VR storytelling using high-resolution projection technologies.
Festival Role: Contributor to Egon Schiele—A Personal Encounter (Deep Space 8K)
Bio: Sebastian Endler creates 3D environments and animated sequences for VR experiences. He contributed to bringing Egon Schiele’s paintings into 3D space
Conversation Tip: Talk about 3D modelling techniques and invite him to mentor students at hosq.’s VR lab.

Name: Michael Geidel
Institution Description: CIS develops VR applications for cultural heritage and educational storytelling.
Festival Role: Contributor to Egon Schiele—A Personal Encounter (Deep Space 8K)
Bio: Michael Geidel codes interactive systems for VR installations. He worked on the Egon Schiele project to create a seamless immersive experience
Conversation Tip: Discuss cross‑platform VR design and propose technical exchange sessions with hosq’s developers.

Name: Natan Sinigaglia
Institution Description: Natan Sinigaglia explores the synergy between music and computer graphics to generate audio‑visual performances.
Festival Role: Creator of Forms of Resonance (Deep Space 8K)
Bio: Natan Sinigaglia integrates real‑time music composition with generative visuals. Forms of Resonance translates sound frequencies into abstract imagery
Conversation Tip: Invite him to demonstrate his audio‑visual tools and discuss collaborative performances with Armenian musicians.

Name: Agustin Muriago
Institution Description: Agustin Muriago combines classical piano performance with interactive technologies and research on perception.
Festival Role: Performer in Forms of Resonance (Deep Space 8K)
Bio: Agustin Muriago collaborates with composers to experiment with real‑time piano and digital visuals. Forms of Resonance pairs his performance with generative imagery
Conversation Tip: Discuss cross‑disciplinary performances blending classical music and tech and plan concerts in Armenia.

Name: Leon Butler
Institution Description: ULTRACOMBOS produces interactive storytelling projects that blur the line between physical and digital performance.
Bio: Leon Butler directs multi‑sensory performances combining live theatre, projection mapping and interactive sculpture. Foolish Flame is an installation exploring ritual and technology
Conversation Tip: Ask about integrating ritual and technology and propose collaborative site‑specific performances in Armenia.

Name: Peter Power
Institution Description: ULTRACOMBOS fosters cross‑disciplinary collaborations in digital performance, sound design and installation art.
Bio: Peter Power composes music for theatre, film and immersive installations. For Foolish Flame he creates sonic textures that respond to audience movement
Conversation Tip: Discuss sound in immersive environments and invite him to collaborate on interactive soundscapes for hosq’s events.

Name: Brigitta Muntendorf
Institution Description: Brigitta Muntendorf explores hybrid opera forms and the interplay of acoustic instruments with digital media.
Festival Role: Speaker at STAGED REALITIES (Act I) and collaborator on AI‑theater projects
Bio: Brigitta Muntendorf is a German composer known for integrating electronic media into contemporary music. She co‑curates AI‑theater formats and performs at Staged Realities.

Name: Anders Hasmo
Institution Description: Det Norske Teatret is a Norwegian theatre company experimenting with digital dramaturgy and immersive experiences.
Festival Role: Speaker at STAGED REALITIES (Act I) and contributor to The Trial Against Humanity
Bio: Anders Hasmo blends interactive storytelling and theatre. He co‑develops digital dramaturgy tools at Det Norske Teatret and contributes to AI‑infused performances.

Name: Oona Valarie & Ufuk Serbest
Institution Description: FIFTITU% is a feminist network in Linz promoting gender equality in art and culture; the Game and Object Group develops interactive AR experiences.
Festival Role: Creators of Fearless Women AR walk (Digital Theater)
Bio: Oona Valarie and Ufuk Serbest design augmented reality experiences that highlight overlooked histories. Their project Fearless Women leads audiences through Linz with AR narratives about feminist activists

Name: Jeremiah Diephuis
Institution: University of Applied Sciences Upper Austria
Institution Description: The university’s GameLab supports research and production of playful media, interactive installations and digital storytelling.
Bio: Jeremiah Diephuis is a game designer and professor who co‑founded the GameLab at the University of Applied Sciences Upper Austria. He curates exhibitions of playful media and explores the social impact of games.
Conversation Tip: Discuss gamification in art and propose co‑curated playful media showcases in Armenia.

Name: Katja Zibrek
Institution: Institute for Cultural Information in Slovenia & France
Institution Description: Katja Zibrek studies user experience and embodied interaction, working across academia and cultural institutions.
Bio: Katja Zibrek researches the psychology of interactive media and co‑curates exhibitions exploring play, VR and mixed reality. She collaborates internationally with universities and museums.
Conversation Tip: Share hosq’s experiments with mixed reality and discuss hosting a residency focusing on playful interaction.

Name: Calin Segal
Institution Description: Independent artist exploring digital identities, algorithmic content and interactive installations.
Festival Role: Creator of "Whispers" in Theme Exhibition – PANIC
Bio: Romanian artist Calin Segal creates interactive installations that examine how algorithmically curated content shapes our identities. His work "Whispers" invites visitors to reflect on digital discourses
Conversation Tip: Discuss how algorithmic systems influence culture and share hosq’s research in digital humanities.

Name: Noemi Iglesias Barrios
Institution Description: Spanish artist working at the intersection of social practice and AI surveillance.
Festival Role: Creator of "The Falling City" (Theme Exhibition – PANIC)
Bio: Noemi Iglesias Barrios collaborates with Radix, the Knowledge Center Data and Society and the League for Human Rights to create “The Falling City” – an AI‑driven surveillance artwork searching for love rather than aggression
Conversation Tip: Talk about ethical AI surveillance and opportunities to co‑curate sociotechnical projects.

Name: Etsuko Ichihara
Institution Description: CCBT is a creative platform in Tokyo supporting artists and citizens to develop digital storytelling and participatory media.
Bio: Japanese artist Etsuko Ichihara collaborates with CCBT to present “Dystopia Land,” a participatory exhibition that imagines a dystopian parallel universe and invites visitors to explore future resilience
Conversation Tip: Discuss participatory art and propose cross‑cultural storytelling workshops.

Name: Jin Lee
Institution Description: Artist exploring the intersection of technology and nature through kinetic installations.
Bio: Jin Lee’s installation “Liminal Ring” uses laminar air currents as a poetic symbol of the fragile balance between order and complexity in natural systems

Name: Marc Vilanova
Institution Description: Spanish sound artist known for large-scale installations exploring infrasound and perception.
Bio: Marc Vilanova’s monumental sound installation “Phonos” employs 208 recycled loudspeakers to translate inaudible infrasound frequencies into visible and audible movements

Name: Paula Gaetano Adi
Institution Description: RPI hosts the School of Humanities, Arts and Social Sciences, fostering critical media art and science collaborations.
Festival Role: Winner of Golden Nica (AI and Life Art) for “Guanaquerx”; exhibited in Prix Ars Electronica Exhibition
Bio: Argentine‑born artist Paula Gaetano Adi explores posthumanism and techno‑indigeneity. Her project “Guanaquerx” won the Golden Nica in AI and Life Art

Name: Thomas Kvam
Institution Description: Norwegian artist working with animation, film and critical media art.
Festival Role: Co‑creator of “Requiem for an Exit” (Prix Ars Electronica Exhibition)
Bio: Thomas Kvam, together with Frode Oldereid, created the animated work “Requiem for an Exit,” which won a Golden Nica at the Prix Ars Electronica 2025
Conversation Tip: Discuss experimental animation and propose film screenings or masterclasses.

Name: Frode Oldereid
Institution Description: Norwegian composer and media artist combining sound and animation.
Festival Role: Co‑creator of “Requiem for an Exit” (Prix Ars Electronica Exhibition)
Bio: Frode Oldereid collaborates with Thomas Kvam on media artworks. Their project “Requiem for an Exit” received the Golden Nica in New Animation Art

Name: Navid Navab
Institution Description: Concordia’s Topological Media Lab explores sound, performance and environment through research and art.
Festival Role: Co‑creator of “Organism” (Prix Ars Electronica Exhibition; performance in St. Mary’s Cathedral)
Bio: Navid Navab creates multi‑sensory environments that merge sound, performance and technology. His project “Organism,” with Garnet Willis, won the Golden Nica in Digital Musics
Conversation Tip: Discuss multisensory performance and propose a residency focused on sonic experimentation.

Name: Garnet Willis
Institution Description: Canadian composer and sound engineer collaborating on immersive and spatial sound projects.
Festival Role: Co‑creator of “Organism” (Prix Ars Electronica Exhibition; performance in St. Mary’s Cathedral)
Bio: Garnet Willis partners with Navid Navab on sonic installations and music performances. Their project “Organism” won the Golden Nica in Digital Musics

Name: Samaa Mizar
Institution Description: LIT integrates art and science to address social issues through research and public exhibitionshttps://ars.electronica.art/panic/en/view/LITLinzInstituteofTechnologyExhibition-1e338ddb450c80c5b0d3f9def307c0e0/#:~:text=.
Festival Role: Team member of “Breaking News: Wolpertinger” (LIT Exhibition)
Bio: Samaa Mizar is part of the Breaking News team at LIT. She explores how emotion and prejudice shape judgment and contributes to creating interactive misinformation installations
Conversation Tip: Discuss emotional biases in media and propose collaborative research on data storytelling.

Name: Gustavo Escobedo
Institution Description: LIT fosters interdisciplinary research connecting science, art and technologyhttps://ars.electronica.art/panic/en/view/LITLinzInstituteofTechnologyExhibition-1e338ddb450c80c5b0d3f9def307c0e0/#:~:text=.
Festival Role: Team member of “Breaking News: Wolpertinger” (LIT Exhibition)
Bio: Gustavo Escobedo works on the Breaking News installation, focusing on the social influence of misinformation. He combines technical and artistic approaches
Conversation Tip: Talk about cross‑disciplinary team collaboration and invite him to co‑develop interactive research at hosq.

Name: Michael Preisach
Institution Description: LIT combines engineering and art to address societal challenges through research and public engagementhttps://ars.electronica.art/panic/en/view/LITLinzInstituteofTechnologyExhibition-1e338ddb450c80c5b0d3f9def307c0e0/#:~:text=.
Festival Role: Team member of “Breaking News: Wolpertinger” (LIT Exhibition)
Bio: Michael Preisach contributes to the Breaking News project by developing technical frameworks for visualising and understanding misinformation
Conversation Tip: Discuss technical infrastructure for interactive installations and propose knowledge exchange workshops.

Name: Maki Namekawa
Institution Description: Internationally acclaimed pianist known for interpreting modern and classical works.
Bio: Maki Namekawa performs Philip Glass’s “Mishima-Suite” accompanied by Cori O’Lan’s visuals as part of the Pre‑Opening Week concerts.
Conversation Tip: Discuss live music with immersive visuals and invite her for future performances in Armenia.

Name: Carla Meller
Institution Description: A research center exploring digitality in theater and performance.
Bio: Carla Meller works at the Academy for Theatre and Digitality in Dortmund, coordinating international collaborations and exploring how digital technologies transform theater.
Conversation Tip: Discuss hosq’s cross-disciplinary programs and explore exchange opportunities with the Academy for Theatre and Digitality.

Name: Dan Wilcox
Institution Description: Ars Electronica’s artistic research and development lab merging art, science, and technology.
Festival Role: Artist; co-creator of Oribotic Instruments (Futurelab Night)
Bio: Dan Wilcox is an artist, musician and roboticist known for his experimental instruments and interactive performances; part of the Oribotic Instruments project at Futurelab.
Conversation Tip: Ask about Oribotic Instruments and discuss possibilities for workshops and residencies in Armenia.

Name: Stefan Mittlböck-Jungwirth-Fohringer
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica that prototypes future ideas at the intersection of art and technology.
Festival Role: Presenter at Futurelab Night (Inference Ground Truth)
Bio: Stefan Mittlböck-Jungwirth-Fohringer is a researcher at Ars Electronica Futurelab working on immersive technologies and data-driven art.
Conversation Tip: Talk about immersive data visualizations and potential collaborations between Futurelab and hosq’s labs.

Name: Will Tallent
Institution Description: Part of the Deep Stage team exploring immersive stage technologies.
Bio: Will Tallent collaborates on Deep Stage, blending AI, robotics and stage design to explore new performance possibilities.
Conversation Tip: Discuss innovative stage technologies and possibilities for artist exchange.

Name: Michael Bruner
Institution Description: Part of the Deep Stage team exploring immersive stage technologies.
Bio: Michael Bruner is involved in the Deep Stage project, which experiments with AI and immersive environments for live performance.
Conversation Tip: Share hosq’s interest in immersive performance and explore potential collaborations.

Name: Lee Jung In
Institution Description: Independent performance artist collective.
Bio: Lee Jung In is a performance artist known for merging dance, physical theater and new media; presenting Der Atem 17/19 in Deep Space 8K.
Conversation Tip: Discuss performance art and possibilities for residencies and workshops in Armenia.

Name: Johannes Pöll
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Festival Role: Member of Converge 2 team and Inference Ground Truth
Bio: Johannes Pöll is a developer and artist at Futurelab working on immersive collaborative experiences like Converge 2 and data-driven art.
Conversation Tip: Talk about collaborative XR tools and share hosq’s plans for interactive labs.

Name: Raphael Schaumburg-Lippe
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Festival Role: Member of Converge 2 and Inference Ground Truth team
Bio: Raphael Schaumburg-Lippe works on collaborative XR experiences and data art within Futurelab’s SHARESPACE projects.
Conversation Tip: Discuss the SHARESPACE platform and explore potential integration with hosq’s residency programs.

Name: Patrick Berger
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Patrick Berger develops collaborative virtual environments like Converge 2 that explore social interactions in XR.
Conversation Tip: Ask about social XR experiences and share hosq’s ideas for cross-border collaborations.

Name: Victor Petro
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Victor Petro contributes to the design of multiplayer XR experiences in projects like Converge 2.
Conversation Tip: Share hosq’s plans for experimental game design labs and explore collaboration.

Name: Peter Holzkorn
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Peter Holzkorn investigates interspecies communication and machine learning in Corpus Corax.
Conversation Tip: Discuss sound art, AI, and potential residencies focused on ecology and technology.

Name: Nicolas Naveau
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Nicolas Naveau explores AI and animal behavior in interactive installations like Corpus Corax.
Conversation Tip: Talk about AI-driven art and explore how hosq could host similar projects.

Name: Anna Weiss
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Anna Weiss works on interactive projects combining art and science, including Corpus Corax.
Conversation Tip: Discuss art-science collaborations and invite her to share insights with hosq’s labs.

Name: Johannes Hiemetsberger
Institution Description: A professional choir and vocal ensemble based in Vienna.
Festival Role: Director of Company of Music performing at Opening
Bio: Johannes Hiemetsberger is the founder and artistic director of Company of Music, known for inventive choral programs.
Conversation Tip: Talk about choral innovations and potential collaborations with Armenian ensembles.

Name: Martin Achrainer
Institution Description: Baritone of international opera stages and a soloist in Landestheater Linz.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis at Big Concert Night
Bio: Martin Achrainer is an Austrian baritone who performs in both opera and concert stages; he sings in The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Discuss operatic collaborations and invite him to perform in Armenia.

Name: Michael Wagner
Institution Description: Tenor performing across European opera houses.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis at Big Concert Night
Bio: Michael Wagner is an acclaimed tenor who appears with orchestras and opera companies; he performs in The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Talk about cross-cultural opera projects and invite him for performances.

Name: Ulf Bunde
Institution Description: Performer in operas and stage productions.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Ulf Bunde is known for his roles in opera and theater; he performs in The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Ask about interdisciplinary theater and discuss hosq’s art-science programs.

Name: Balint Nemeth
Institution Description: Performer in opera productions.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Balint Nemeth is a singer performing in opera and concert productions; part of The Emperor of Atlantis cast.
Conversation Tip: Discuss transnational musical collaborations and share hosq’s plans for opera residencies.

Name: Gregor Reinhold
Institution Description: Performer of opera and concert repertoire.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Gregor Reinhold is a bass singer performing in The Emperor of Atlantis; he appears with European ensembles.
Conversation Tip: Talk about vocal performance and explore potential residencies or guest appearances.

Name: Chinara Azimova
Institution Description: Soprano performing in opera companies.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Chinara Azimova is an operatic soprano appearing in The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Discuss female vocal artistry and explore possibilities for joint recitals.

Name: Su Rongna
Institution Description: Performer in opera productions.
Festival Role: Performer in The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Su Rongna is a mezzo-soprano performing in The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Talk about cross-cultural music collaboration and invite to participate in Armenian music events.

Name: Anna Hausberger
Institution Description: Research center at JKU bridging technology, art and society.
Festival Role: Co-creator of Breaking News: Wolpertinger sighted in Linz!
Bio: Anna Hausberger works on computational social science and misinformation; part of the LIT exhibition at Ars Electronica.
Conversation Tip: Discuss data literacy programs and explore collaboration with hosq’s education initiatives.

Name: Arno Deutschbauer
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Arno Deutschbauer works on interactive installations and is part of the SHARESPACE project team.
Conversation Tip: Share hosq’s interest in XR installations and explore joint R&D projects.

Name: Maria Arnal
Institution Description: Catalan singer known for experimental and folk-inspired music.
Bio: Maria Arnal fuses folk music with electronic sound; she performs at the Ars Electronica Nightline.
Conversation Tip: Discuss the intersection of traditional and experimental music and potential guest performances in Armenia.

Name: Dennis Russell Davies
Institution Description: Renowned conductor leading major orchestras in Europe and the US.
Bio: Dennis Russell Davies is an American conductor known for championing contemporary composers; he leads the Big Concert Night.
Conversation Tip: Talk about contemporary orchestral music and explore possibilities for joint performances in Armenia.

Name: Oona Valarie
Institution Description: Women’s art organization advocating for gender equality in art and culture.
Festival Role: Co-creator of Parallels digital theater piece
Bio: Oona Valarie works with Ufuk Serbest in the FIFTITU% collective to explore feminist utopias through digital theatre projects like Parallels.
Conversation Tip: Discuss feminist and intersectional perspectives in digital art and potential exchange programs.

Name: Ufuk Serbest
Institution Description: Women’s art organization advocating for gender equality in art and culture.
Festival Role: Co-creator of Parallels digital theater piece
Bio: Ufuk Serbest collaborates with Oona Valarie on projects exploring feminist utopias and digital storytelling.
Conversation Tip: Discuss intersectional digital art practices and invite them to contribute to hosq events.

Name: Marc Da Costa
Institution Description: Experimental arts collective investigating humans and technology.
Festival Role: Co-creator of Parallels digital theater piece
Bio: Marc Da Costa blends anthropology and technology in interactive art; co-creates the Parallels digital theatre piece.
Conversation Tip: Discuss the interplay of anthropology and technology and explore cross-continental storytelling initiatives.

Name: Matthew Niederhauser
Institution Description: Experimental arts collective investigating humans and technology.
Festival Role: Co-creator of Parallels digital theatre piece
Bio: Matthew Niederhauser is an artist and filmmaker exploring interactive installations and digital culture.
Conversation Tip: Talk about new media storytelling and potential cross-cultural film projects.

Name: Kairos Futura team
Institution Description: African research lab exploring future scenarios and sustainable technologies.
Festival Role: STARTS Prize Africa winners (The Wild Future Lab)
Bio: Kairos Futura is a Kenyan lab exploring sustainable futures and traditional knowledge through art and science.
Conversation Tip: Discuss pan-African collaboration and explore joint art-science projects between Armenia and Africa.

Name: Katja Mayer
Institution Description: Leading university in Austria.
Festival Role: Speaker at New Pathways: AI, Art & Citizen Science
Bio: Katja Mayer researches open science and digital governance; she speaks on citizen science and AI.
Conversation Tip: Discuss open science practices and potential partnerships for citizen science projects.

Name: Anna Berti Suman
Institution Description: University and EU research centre focusing on environmental governance and law.
Festival Role: Speaker at New Pathways: AI, Art & Citizen Science
Bio: Anna Berti Suman studies citizen-led environmental monitoring and digital rights; she speaks on citizen science governance.
Conversation Tip: Discuss participatory science and potential collaborations on environmental projects in Armenia.

Name: Cristina Nava
Institution: Outreach innovation centre / European Citizen Science Association
Institution Description: Organization promoting citizen science across Europe.
Festival Role: Panelist at New Pathways: AI, Art & Citizen Science
Bio: Cristina Nava works on public participation in science and digital inclusion; she speaks on bridging communities and technology.
Conversation Tip: Talk about community-driven science and invite her to share insights with hosq’s labs.

Name: Elisabeth Schauermann
Institution Description: Austrian NGO advocating for fundamental rights and freedoms in the digital age.
Festival Role: Panelist at New Pathways: AI, Art & Citizen Science
Bio: Elisabeth Schauermann campaigns for data protection and digital rights, bridging activism and policy.
Conversation Tip: Discuss digital rights and explore collaborations for public programs on digital sovereignty.

Name: Kika Echeverría
Institution Description: Artist working on immersive theater and AI.
Festival Role: Performer in The Echoes of Prometheus
Bio: Kika Echeverría co-creates The Echoes of Prometheus exploring narrative and AI; she collaborates with Carlos Sfeir.
Conversation Tip: Talk about narrative AI and invite her to participate in hosq’s storytelling workshops.

Name: Carlos Sfeir
Institution Description: Developer working on immersive theater and AI.
Festival Role: Performer in The Echoes of Prometheus
Bio: Carlos Sfeir co-develops The Echoes of Prometheus with Kika Echeverría using AI for interactive narratives.
Conversation Tip: Discuss interactive narrative technologies and explore collaboration on storytelling projects.

Name: Anne Wichmann
Institution Description: Artistic R&D lab of Ars Electronica.
Bio: Anne Wichmann is part of the Oribotic Instruments project, exploring music and robotics.
Conversation Tip: Discuss robotic instruments and explore possibilities for workshops.

Name: David Bösch
Institution Description: Freelance opera and theatre director.
Festival Role: Stage director of The Emperor of Atlantis (Big Concert Night)
Bio: David Bösch is a renowned German theatre and opera director; he stages The Emperor of Atlantis at Big Concert Night.
Conversation Tip: Talk about innovative staging and potential collaboration on digital theatre with hosq.

Name: Julian Pixel Schmiederer
Institution Description: Freelance lighting designer for opera and theatre.
Festival Role: Lighting designer for The Emperor of Atlantis
Bio: Julian Pixel Schmiederer designs lighting for theatre and opera; he lights The Emperor of Atlantis.
Conversation Tip: Discuss lighting design and immersive stage technologies.

Name: Martyna Marciniak
Institution: European Digital Deal / Ars Electronica (Linz, Austria, host institution)
Institution Description: The “European Digital Deal” is a Creative Europe co-funded project coordinated by Ars Electronica, offering residencies across Europe; Ars Electronica serves as host and partner organization in Austria
Festival Role: Her project Afterfact as part of the residency will be presented during the Ars Electronica Festival 2025
Bio: Martyna Marciniak is a Polish, Berlin-based artist and researcher. She explores visual storytelling through animation, film, and model-making, focusing on systemic violence and human rights. Her practice employs speculative fictions and allegory to reveal technological and visual biases.
Conversation Tip: Her project Afterfact expands the question “What’s new/s?” with a critical take on the aesthetics of fact and visual literacy, presented as a digital attention guide and audio-visual piece.

Name: Christl Baur
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Institution Description: Overseeing one of the world’s leading digital art festivals; the institution bridges art, technology, and society in Linz.
Bio: Interdisciplinary researcher with training in art history, cultural management, and natural sciences; focuses on aesthetics and social practices at the intersection of art and science, especially in video art, new media, interactive and biotechnological art.

Name: Markus Jandl
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Institution Description: A cultural, educational, and scientific institute governing the Festival, Prix, Center, Futurelab—advancing the intersection of art, technology, and society.
Bio: Joined Ars Electronica in 2001 as an intern; since September 2020, serves as Commercial Director and head of corporate finance; oversees major commercial decisions. Studied economics in Linz.
Conversation Tip: As Commercial Director / CFO, contributes to festival's financial and business strategy.

Name: Karl Julian Schmidinger
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: Technical Director

Name: Hans Christian Merten
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: He studied audio technology and design in Vienna and completed various courses at the Bruckner University in Linz. From 2002 to 2010 he taught at the University of Applied Sciences in Hagenberg (media technology and design) and at the Secondary School for Communication and Media in Freistadt.

Name: Masha Zolotova
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: Head of Exhibitions. Researcher, curator, project manager and producer of contemporary art projects

Name: Johanna Lenhart
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: With a background in German philology and comparative literature, Johanna Lenhart taught as OEAD lecturer at universities in Egypt and the Czech Republic before joining Ars Electronica in 2023.
Conversation Tip: Her teaching and research focus on narrative practices in different media and contexts, with a passion for how storytelling shapes our past, present and future.

Name: Laura Welzenbach
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: Laura Welzenbach produces and directs visionary art projects at the intersection of technology, society, and politics. She is a strategic planner whose current superpower is a deep passion for generating social impact through art and public engagement.
Conversation Tip: As Head of Ars Electronica Export, Laura creates experiences that connect art and science. These international collaborations take shape in the form of exhibitions, workshops, and art-science residencies.

Name: Anita Halbartschlager
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)

Name: Veronika Krenn
Institution: Ars Electronica Festival (Ars Electronica Linz GmbH & Co KG)
Bio: Veronika Krenn is a producer at Ars Electronica and is responsible, among other things, for the new developments of exhibitions at the Ars Electronica Center. Since graduating from the Interface Cultures program at the Linz University of Art, she has been active as an artist and cultural worker. In her work, she explores unconventional communication strategies in the field of media art and Eat Art.

Name: Philippe Mistakopulo
Bio: Philipp is a strategist and communicator who bridges art and business. His challenge lies in balancing creativity with structure—crafting strong concepts without getting overwhelmed by operations.
Conversation Tip: He seeks focus to scale ideas while preserving their depth and meaning.

Name: Fara Peluso
Bio: Fara Peluso is a bio artist, designer, and researcher with a strong interest in biology and micro algae, enquiring into their agency and poetics through a speculative design.
Conversation Tip: Peluso wants to raise critical questions about the design of new tools and how they can tell the story of possible future scenarios about the quality of our lives, attitudes, and choices.

Name: Santiago Morilla
Bio: Santiago Morilla is a multidisciplinary artist, PhD in contemporary art (extraordinary award 2021 by the Complutense University of Madrid–UCM), specialised in New Media Art at the MEDIA Lab of the University of Art and Design Helsinki, and lecturer in Bachelor's and Master's degrees at UCM.
Conversation Tip: He develops his art-based research within the synergies between contemporary art + (post)nature + situated technologies, with a special interest in interspecies communication and data visualisation.

Name: Emma Harris
Bio: Emma Harris is a visual anthropologist, filmmaker, and visual artist working across ethnography, cinematic poetry, and low-toxicity analog processes. Her work looks into multispecies relations in regenerative agriculture, where soil is viewed as a living ecosystem to collaborate with
Conversation Tip: Here she explores a new material aesthetic in agriculture through cinematic poetry and plant based analog processes to establish a greater sensitivity towards other life forms in the biosphere.

Name: Mali Weil
Bio: Mali Weil is an artistic platform established by Elisa Di Liberato, Lorenzo Facchinelli and Mara Ferrieri, based in South Tyrol (IT). She develops an expanded performative research that investigates the spaces and modes of disclosure of political imagination, on ecological issues.
Conversation Tip: Her visual production ranges from performance to product and speculative design, from editorial to film, but she also works through open and participatory set ups as platforms for discussion and exchange.

Name: Nicoletta Tranquillo
Bio: I’m the founding partner of Kilowatt and the cultural director of Serra Madre. Although I’m an economist, I have always focused on ecology, climate change, and the environmental crisis, combining different disciplines.
Conversation Tip: I have spent years supporting the creation and growth of organizations and business models with a significant social and environmental impact. Today, I’m particularly committed to promoting practices that encourage ecological thinking and imagination across art and science.

Name: Wendi Yan
Bio: Wendi Yan is an artist, technologist, and writer narrating metamorphoses of the scientific self.
Conversation Tip: She examines the cosmological, linguistic, and physiological challenges in facing alien epistemic systems across time and crafts alternative fictions of science and its history through CGI films, games, and archival displays of sculptural objects.

Name: Hideaki Ogawa
Bio: Hideaki Ogawa was born in Tokyo, Japan, and has been based in Linz, Austria, since 2007. He has served as an artist, curator, and Key Researcher of Art Thinking at Ars Electronica.
Conversation Tip: Currently, he is the Artistic Director of the Ars Electronica Futurelab, the organization’s research and development division. He also holds the roles of Artistic Director for the Sapporo International Art Festival 2027 and Creative Director of Civic Creative Base Tokyo.
